qas.question: What is the name of the study done by composer Ryan Maguire?
What did the study aim to isolate?
What is the track "moDernisT" an anagram of?
Where was an account of the study published?
Which year was the study published?

context: An in-depth study of MP3 audio quality, sound artist and composer Ryan Maguire's project "<a0_0>The Ghost in the MP3<a0_0/>" isolates the <a1_0>sounds lost during MP3 compression<a1_0/>. In 2015, he released the track "moDernisT" (an anagram of "<a2_0>Tom's Diner<a2_0/>"), composed exclusively from the sounds deleted during MP3 compression of the song "Tom's Diner", the track originally used in the formulation of the MP3 standard. A detailed account of the techniques used to isolate the sounds deleted during MP3 compression, along with the conceptual motivation for the project, was published in the <a4_0>2014<a4_0/> Proceedings of the <a3_0>International Computer Music Conference<a3_0/>.
